profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on March 17, 2009

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: From title page: Incorporating most of the contents of a volume written, printed, and published by Oliver Norton Worden in 1868 entitled "Some Records of Persons by the name of Worden, Particularly of over one thousand of the ancestors, kin, and descendants of John and Elizabeth Worden of Washington County, Rhode Island. Covering three hundred years, and comprising twelve generations in America." and incorporating most of the manuscript material prepared in 1972 by Mrs. Marjorie W. Schunke entitled "The Worden Family in R.I." and based upon the research of Mrs. Vivian Y. Brecknell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: From title page: Incorporating most of the contents of a volume written, printed, and published by Oliver Norton Worden in 1868 entitled "Some Records of Persons by the name of Worden, Particularly of over one thousand of the ancestors, kin, and descendants of John and Elizabeth Worden of Washington County, Rhode Island. Covering three hundred years, and comprising twelve generations in America." and incorporating most of the manuscript material prepared in 1972 by Mrs. Marjorie W. Schunke entitled "The Worden Family in R.I." and based upon the research of Mrs. Vivian Y. Brecknell.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Some records of persons by the name of Worden : particularly of over one thousand of the ancestors, kin, and descendants of John and Elizabeth Worden, of Washington county, Rhode Island, covering three hundred years, and comprising twelve generations in America ... / by O. N. Worden
Approximate Worden census, 1640-1780, for the family of Peter Worden of Yarmouth : a guide to the growth and migration of the family / prepared and copyrighted, 1983, by Gilbert S. Bahn
Worden, Werden, Wording family family : History and Genealogy Unit Special Genealogical File, 1886-1981

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

p.emph: Inscription on inside front cover: Conveyed to the Connecticut State Library with the provision that no photocopying whatsoever is permitted.
